results.title: Jakob Gimpel, pianist: program No. 13
results.creator_credit: Paul Gordon, George Moskov and Official Films
results.brief_description: A Felix Mendelssohn recital performed by Polish-American pianist, Jakob Gimpel, featuring “Etude in F Major” (Opus 104, No. 2), and two songs without words - “Lost illusions” (Opus 67, No. 2) and “Spinning song” (Opus 67, No. 4).

results.title: Jack Marin: forward play. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jack Marin, one of the outstanding shooters in professional basketball, demonstrates the art of foul shooting, developing one “fluid motion”, proper rebounding strategies and tactics and offensive rebounding.

results.title: Jack Marin: forward play. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jack Marin, one of the outstanding shooters in professional ranks, demonstrates some of the shots which have helped him achieve this remarkable record. He concentrates on the jump shot, the staple of his repertoire, showing how “squaring up” the body and keeping it in line are essential, and how rolling the ball of one’s fingers is the proper release. He also demonstrates various driving moves a forward must conquer.

results.title: It's easy when you know how
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Nicholas Cockram and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Children who have difficulty in learning may be lacking in the basic skills of the spoken or written language. They may appear to be dull, difficult, dyslexic or handicapped but step by step teaching may reveal that they have the ability to learn.

results.title: The Italian Peninsula
results.brief_description: A brief survey of the geography of Italy. A map is used to explain the position of the Alps and the Appennines and also the main cities and regions of the country. Illustrations include views of citrus groves in Southern Italy; Mt. Vesuvius; Naples; Rome, the city; St. Peter’s, the tomb of Hadrian; silk-worm culture; wheat and rice growing; hydro-electric plant in the Alps; factories in Milan.

results.title: It didn't have to happen
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the careless worker who scorns safety devices on modern machinery endangers not only his own life but the lives of fellow workers. It portrays a careless employee and the tragic result of his slipshod methods. Designed to show employers in industry why guards are put on machines and how they should be used.

results.title: It came to stay
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the motor industry in Australia from approximately 1904 and shows the significant changes that have taken place in this field. The film shows the production of motor cars from molten metal to finished product.

results.title: Island target
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.

results.title: Island of dreams: a fable for our time
results.brief_description: An animated film showing a man going through the rat race called “earning a living” and fighting both people and traffic. At home there is no escape from noise and distraction; he dreams of an island paradise which in the end reveals its own problems.
